com.wizzer.mle.runtime.event

Class MleEventManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wizzer.mle.runtime.event.MleEventManager

  • public class MleEventManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to help manage events. A registry is kept for bookkeeping, in order to generate unique event identifiers on-the-fly.
    Author:
    Mark S. Millard

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  MleEventManager.EventSetItem
      Utility class used to manage named events.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static MleEventManager getInstance()
        Get the Singleton instance of the event manager.
        Returns:
        The Singleton is returned.

      • hasEvent

        public boolean hasEvent(int id)
        Determine if the event manager already contains the specified event.
        Parameters:
        id - The event identifier to test.
        Returns:
        true will be returned if the event manager already has the specified event registered. Otherwise, false will be returned.

      • hasEvent

        public boolean hasEvent(java.lang.String name)
        Determine if the event manager already contains the named event.
        Parameters:
        name - The event name to test.
        Returns:
        true will be returned if the event manager already has the specified event registered. Otherwise, false will be returned.

      • addEvent

        public void addEvent(int id,
                     java.lang.String name)
              throws MleRuntimeException
        Register an event with the event manager.
        Parameters:
        id - The event identifier. Nothing will be done if the event has previously been registered.
        name - The named event; must be unique or null.
        Throws:
        MleRuntimeException - This exception is thrown if an event already exists for the specified name.

      • getEventId

        public int getEventId(java.lang.String name)
        Get the event identifier for the named event.
        Parameters:
        name - The named event.
        Returns:
        If the named event is registered, then the value of the event identifier will be returned. If the named event does not exist, then MleEvent.MLE_EVENT_INVALID_ID will be returned.

      • getEventName

        public java.lang.String getEventName(int id)
        Get the name for the specified event.
        Parameters:
        id - The event identifier.
        Returns:
        If the event is registered, then the name of the event will be returned. This value may be null if the event was not registered with a name. If the event does not exist, then null will be returned.

      • removeEvent

        public void removeEvent(int id)
        Unregister an event from the event manager.
        Parameters:
        id - The event identifier. Nothing happens if the registry does not contain the specified event.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clear the event manager registry of all events.

      • size

        public int size()
        Get the number of events registered with the event manager.
        Returns:
        The number of registered events is returned.

      • okToExit

        public static boolean okToExit()
        Determine whether it is ok to exit.
        Returns:
        true will be returned if it is Ok to exit. Otherwise, false will be returned.

      • setExitStatus

        public static void setExitStatus(boolean status)
        Set the exit state.
        Parameters:
        status - This parameter should be true if it is Ok to exit the application/title. If it is not Ok to exit, then the status should be set to false.

      • createEvent

        public static int createEvent(short group)
        Create an event identifier for the specified group.
        Parameters:
        group - The group identifier to create an event for.
        Returns:
        A new event identifier will be returned. Note that the returned event has not yet been added to the event manager (see addEvent(int)).
        See Also:
        MleEvent
